displaytitle: Memoranda Sunsets on the Devon Coast
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

titles.title: Memoranda Sunsets on the Devon Coast

makers.displaydate: 1805–1881; born Newington, England; died Redhill, England
makers.displaymaker: Samuel Palmer, 1805–1881; born Newington, England; died Redhill, England

texts.textentryhtml: A.H. Palmer; Mark Oliver; Durlacher; Mather Collection.

No longer working in the mystical manner of Shoreham Paddock, Palmer produced these studies of atmospheric effects while on the northern coast of Devon, looking toward Lundy Island. Alongside the watercolor sketches, Palmer wrote his thoughts about the view and the meteorological conditions. The two studies are of the same view at different times on July 10: the top image was made at about 7 p.m., the bottom after 8 p.m. Palmer reflects on the different qualities of light, noting "mirror like brightness" at seven and a setting sun after eight. He was discontent with the sunset, calling it "a disagreeable sunset–too much vapour over sky & sea."
texts.remarks: K2 Corridor Rotation British Landscapes Febuary 2016
